This still means you can make a hang-glider, just make him under the wing but face the same way. Did you try to have him fly upside-down before?

The main issue is that Kerbals will slide off of the ladder fairly easily. They are not actually part of the craft so have their own momentum and will go zipping offthe ends of the ladder in even fairly low speed maneuvers. I probably could get it to work with the kerbal under the wings, but I really disliked that I couldn't get him facing the right way.
I guess they can hag on upside down

But why hang upside down? That definitely won't survive re-entry.

EDIT: Not to mention landing...

Attach a ladder to a large parachute, add a couple of bits to hold the kerbal in place, activate the parachute and detatch it from a re-entering craft. It will go from space to landing and the kerbal will survive, and you can even jump off just before it hits the ground.
The craft itself can survive landing when right-side up.. you just have to slow waaaaaay down, and it was never meant as a re-entry vehicle, just experimentation and seeing if I could get it to work
Well I like the way it is begins flight however, would it be possible to hook it to a rocket so it can be dropped higher in the atmosphere? I think it would be quite fun to glide down at high speeds.
The EVA Kerbals get blown off the craft immediately when moving at any high speed.
